oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Johnny Horton interview - Bob Stoner - 1959-07 - KWKH
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Johnny Horton (performer), as conducted by Bob Stoner on radio station KWKH (Shreveport, La.) in July of 1959.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tone -- (00:28) Bob Stoner congratulates Johnny Horton for his recent gold record The Battle Of New Orleans -- (00:55) Horton talks about receiving a gold record, and how blessed he is -- (01:37) Horton talks about some other artists who recorded the same tune, and how good they all were -- (02:14) Horton talks about recently visiting Florida with other artists, and being intimidated by some other big artists -- (02:52) Horton talks about singing differently depending on how he feels about the song, regardless of it being pop or country -- (03:38) Horton talks about never hearing about another country artist receiving a gold record -- (04:42) Horton talks about how many sales it takes for a record to receive gold status -- (05:00) Horton talks about a new, upcoming record -- (05:50) Horton talks about also receiving a platinum record -- (06:30) Horton talks about The Battle Of New Orleans being rewritten -- (07:47) Stoner congratulates Horton again, and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: KWKH (Radio station : Shreveport, La.); Horton, Johnny;
